1.verse_text: The LORD "s word that came to Joel, Pethuel"s son: pay attention, everyone in the land! Has anything like this ever happened in your days, and have your children tell their children, and their children tell their children. the swarming locust has eaten. What the swarming locust left, the hopping locust has eaten. And what the hopping locust left, Scream over the sweet wine, all you wine drinkers, because it is snatched from your mouth; has invaded my land. Its teeth are like lions" teeth; its fangs are like those of a lioness. splintered my fig trees, stripped off their bark and thrown it down; their branches have turned white. one who has lost the husband of her youth. The priests and the LORD "s ministers mourn. the ground mourns; for the grain is destroyed, the new wine dries up, the olive oil fails. howl, you vinedressers, over the wheat and the barley, for the crops of the field are destroyed. the fig tree withers. Pomegranate, palm, and apple– all the trees of the field are dried up. lament, ministers of the altar. Come, spend the night in funeral clothing, servants of my God, because the grain offering and the drink offering have gone from the temple of your God. request a special assembly. Gather the elders and all the land"s people to the temple of the LORD your God, and cry out to the LORD . The day of the LORD is near; right before our eyes? Aren"t joy and gladness also gone from our God"s house? the barns are empty. The granaries are in ruin because the grain has dried up. Herds of cattle are in distress because there is no pasture for them; even the flocks of sheep pant. for fire has completely destroyed the pastures of the wilderness; and flames have burned all the trees of the field. because the streams have dried up; the fire has completely destroyed the meadows of the wilderness.
Hear this, elders; or in the days of your ancestors? the devouring locust has eaten. Joy fades away from the people. it comes like chaos from the Almighty.
Wake up, you who drink too much, and weep.
because a nation, powerful and beyond number,
Lament like a woman dressed in funeral clothing,
The grain offering and the drink offering are gone from the LORD "s temple.
Dress for a funeral and grieve, you priests;
The grain shrivels under the shovels;
Even the field"s wild animals cry to you

2.verse_text: Blow the horn in Zion; give a shout on my holy mountain! Let all the people of the land tremble, for the day of the LORD is coming. It is near– a day of clouds and thick darkness! Like blackness spread out upon the mountains, unlike any that has ever come before them, or will come after them in centuries ahead. and behind them a flame burns. Land ahead of them is like Eden"s garden, but they leave behind them a barren wasteland; nothing escapes them. and like warhorses they charge, They leap on the mountaintops– like the crackling of a fire"s flame, devouring the stubble; like a powerful army ready for battle. all faces turn red with worry. like soldiers they climb the wall. Each keeps to their own path; they didn"t change their course. each keeps to their own path. Even if they fall among the weapons, they won"t stop. they run upon the walls. They climb into the houses; they enter through the windows like thieves. the heavens shake. The sun and the moon are darkened; the stars have stopped shining, at the head of his army. How numerous are his troops! Mighty are those who obey his word. The day of the LORD is great; it stirs up great fear–who can endure it? return to me with all your hearts, with fasting, with weeping, and with sorrow; and not your clothing. Return to the LORD your God, for he is merciful and compassionate, very patient, full of faithful love, and ready to forgive. and leave a blessing behind him, a grain offering and a drink offering for the LORD your God? demand a fast; request a special assembly. prepare a holy meeting; assemble the elders; gather the children, even nursing infants. Let the groom leave his room and the bride her chamber. let the priests, the LORD "s ministers, weep. Let them say, 'Have mercy, LORD , on your people, and don"t make your inheritance a disgrace, an example of failure among the nations. Why should they say among the peoples, "Where is their God?"' See, I am sending you the corn, new wine, and fresh oil, and you will be fully satisfied by it; and I will no longer make you a disgrace among the nations. and drive it into a dried-up and desolate land, its front into the eastern sea, and its rear into the western sea. Its stench will rise up; its stink will come to the surface. The LORD is about to do great things! rejoice and be glad, for the LORD is about to do great things! for the meadows of the wilderness will turn green; the tree will bear its fruit; the fig tree and grapevine will give their full yield. rejoice and be glad in the LORD your God, because he will give you the early rain as a sign of righteousness; he will pour down abundant rain for you, the vats will overflow with new wine and fresh oil. that the cutting locust, the swarming locust, the hopping locust, and the devouring locust have eaten– my great army, which I sent against you. and you will praise the name of the LORD your God, who has done wonders for you; and my people will never again be put to shame. and that I am the LORD your God–no other exists; never again will my people be put to shame. your sons and your daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, and your young men will see visions. spirit on the male and female slaves.
a day of darkness and no light, a great and powerful army comes, the early and the late rain, as before.
In front of them a fire consumes;
They resemble horses,
like the rumbling of chariots.
In their presence, peoples shake with fear;
Like warriors they charge;
They don"t crowd each other;
They rush upon the city;
The earth quakes before them;
because the LORD utters his voice
Yet even now, says the LORD ,
tear your hearts
Who knows whether he will have a change of heart
Blow the horn in Zion;
Gather the people;
Between the porch and the altar
Then the LORD became passionate about this land, and had pity on his people.
The LORD responded to the people:
I will remove the northern army far from you
Don"t fear, fertile land;
Don"t be afraid, animals of the field,
Children of Zion,
The threshing floors will be full of grain;
I will repay you for the years
You will eat abundantly and be satisfied,
You will know that I am in the midst of Israel,
After that I will pour out my spirit upon everyone;
In those days, I will also pour out my
I will give signs in the heavens and on the earth–blood and fire and columns of smoke.
The sun will be turned to darkness, and the moon to blood before the great and dreadful day of the LORD comes.

But everyone who calls on the LORD "s name will be saved; for on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be security, as the LORD has promised; and in Jerusalem, the LORD will summon those who survive.

3.verse_text: Truly, in those days and in that time, I will bring back to Judah and Jerusalem those who were sent away.

I will gather all the nations, and I will bring them to the Jehoshaphat Valley. There I will enter into judgment with them in support of my people and my possession, Israel, which they have scattered among the nations. They have divided my land,
and have cast lots for my people. They have traded boys for prostitutes, and sold girls for wine, which they drank down.
What are you to me, Tyre and Sidon, and all the regions of Philistia? Are you paying me back for something? If you are paying me back, then in a flash I will turn your deeds back upon your own heads.
You have taken my silver and my gold, and have carried my rich treasures into your temples.
You have sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, removing them far from their own border.
But now I am calling them from the places where you have sold them, and I will repay you for your deeds.

I will sell your sons and your daughters as a possession of the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a nation far away; for the Lord has spoken. Prepare a holy war, wake up the warriors; let all the soldiers draw near, let them come up! and your pruning tools into spears; let the weakling say, 'I am mighty.' all you surrounding nations; gather yourselves there; bring your mighty ones, LORD . and come up to the Jehoshaphat Valley; for there I will sit to judge all the surrounding nations. for the harvest is ripe. Go and crush grapes, for the winepress is full. The jars overflow with wine, for their wickedness is great. for the day of the LORD is near in the valley of judgment. the stars have ceased shining. and utters his voice from Jerusalem; the heavens and the earth quake. But the LORD is a refuge for his people, a shelter for the people of Israel. settle down in Zion, my holy mountain. Jerusalem will be holy, and never again will strangers pass through it. the mountains will drip sweet wine, the hills will flow with milk, and all the streambeds of Judah will flow with water; a spring will come forth from the LORD "s house and water the Shittim Valley. and Edom a desolate wilderness. This is because of the violence done to the people of Judah, in whose land they have shed innocent blood. and Jerusalem for all generations. which I had not forgiven. I will act on their account; I will not pardon the guilty. The LORD dwells in Zion.
Announce this among the nations:
Beat the iron tips of your plows into swords
Come quickly,
Let the nations prepare themselves,
Cut with the sickle,
Crowd after crowd fills the valley of judgment,
The sun and the moon are darkened;
The LORD roars from Zion,
So you will know that I am the LORD your God,
In that day
Egypt will become desolate
But Judah will be inhabited forever,
I will forgive their bloodguilt,
